channel.title: Client error when jarred
channel.description:
So my client when ran when it's not via the jar it looks like this - http://prntscr.com/77mhfg But when I jar my client and run it, the tab bar isn't there.. - http://prntscr.com/77mhlt
Any help would be appreciated
Also still need help with this if anyone knows how to fix - https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,670290.0.html

item.title: Client error when jarred
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I doubt it… But you could check by looking at the code in the Gui class.
Typically, all the Gui class does is put a wrapper around the client and adds the buttons.

Read full topic

item.title: Client error when jarred
item.dc:creator: @Gardenn Gardenn
item.description:
@Gardenn wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:3, topic:551607”]When you run the client outside of the jar, you’re probably running it with the main class as “GUI” or "JFrame"
And when you jar it, you’re probably setting the main class as “client”.
The JFrame is what adds the buttons, when you run it without the JFrame the buttons aren’t added.[/quote]

Oh okay, I just checked my run.bat to see, it was Gui! Could that have been causing this issue? - https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,670290.0.html

Read full topic

item.title: Client error when jarred
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

When you run the client outside of the jar, you’re probably running it with the main class as “GUI” or "JFrame"
And when you jar it, you’re probably setting the main class as “client”.
The JFrame is what adds the buttons, when you run it without the JFrame the buttons aren’t added.

Read full topic

item.title: Client error when jarred
item.dc:creator: @malimt malimt
item.description:
@malimt wrote:

This isn’t the right section man. POST IT IN "CLIENT HELP"
I can’t see your 2nd pictures. It’s not showing at all.
Now go post this in client help and i’ll try helping you out.
